overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students develop the rules to solve inequalities in one variable by adding, subtracting, multiplying, or dividing each side of the inequality by the same value and observing its impact on the inequality statement. They solve one-step inequalities and graph their solution sets. Students describe how solving an equation and inequality are similar and how they are different.

overview_item_data_items: I can graph the solution set of an inequality in the form <math><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>r</mi></math> and <math><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi></math>.
I can solve one-step inequalities and graph the solution sets on a number line.

I can interpret the graph of a solution set for inequalities of the form <math><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>r</mi></math> or <math><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi></math> in the context of a real-world or mathematical problem.
An inequality is any mathematical sentence that has an inequality symbol.
The solution set of an inequality is all values that makes the inequality statement true.
The graph of an inequality in one variable is the set of all points on a number line that makes the inequality true.
The Properties of Inequalities allow you to solve inequalities involving any numbers.

To solve a one-step inequality, apply the same inverse operation steps that would solve a one-step equation; however, reverse the inequality symbol when you multiply or divide both sides by a negative value.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Odd One Out: Graphs of Inequalities
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze number lines to determine which one is the odd one out.
Students investigate what happens when you add or subtract both sides of an inequality by the same number.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Multiplying and Dividing by Positive Numbers
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students investigate what happens when you multiply or divide an inequality by a positive number.
Students solve one-step inequalities and graph their solution sets.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Multiplying and Dividing by Negative Numbers
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students investigate what happens when you multiply or divide an inequality by a negative number.
Students generalize their understanding of the Properties of Inequalities.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
